result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie Y Kluge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond and deposits have been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs in the amount of $235.60 to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Time served sentence with credit for 2 days of prior time served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 15CM-477 and 16CM-53 and 16TR-321 - All Cases Called @ 12:15 PM: Defendant Melanie Y Kluge in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Def and counsel acknowledge receipt of Amended Complaint as to 15CM-477 - Reading Waived.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-477 - Plea:  NC  16CM-53 - Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismissed Dom Abuse Enh.  Ct 2 of 15CM-477 and Ct 2 of 16CM-53 Both DRI.  No Statement offered by Def.  The Court:  15CM-477 - 20 days - Report 8/1/16 - 2 days TS credit - Court Costs - Bond to be applied - 60 DTP any Balance plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  16CM-53:  2 days WCJ w/TS credit of 2 days with Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Bond of $200 to be applied to Court Costs.  Appeal Rights Given.  16TR-321 DRI.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Amanda M. Belville in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Belville requests in person status/plea/sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on May 24, 2016 at 09:50 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Amanda Belville in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Per Atty Bellville - requests add'l STC.  STC rescheduled as requested.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 09:50 pm.

15CM477, 16CM53, 16TR321 NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Amanda Belville in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Belville requests an additional status in 30 days.  Court directs defendant to get in contact with her attorney  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 09:35 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 1:19 PM: Defendant Melanie Y Kluge in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not qualify for SPD services due to marital status.  States she is unsure of the counsel issue.   Def changes her position and states she would like counsel.  Court will order that no later than 2/19/2016 a deposit be paid of $250 to COC toward Atty Fees, Commencing 4/1/2016 an add'l $50 per mo PP.   NGP entered by the Court.   ADA argues small cash bond in light of allegation of Bail Jump.  Court orders $200 Cash Bond w/conditions.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Atty Belville enters the Court and agrees to accept the Dean Appointment.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 11:25 am.
